channel.title: distributed computing on Niels Berglund
channel.description: Recent content in distributed computing on Niels Berglund

item.title: Interesting Stuff - Week 37 - 38, 2023
item.description:
This roundup covers last week and this week: Explore the Circuit Breaker Design Pattern with insights from Waldemar and learn how it handles errors in distributed systems. Discover the world of Distributed Computing with Simon’s exploration of Dapr’s sidecar pattern, simplifying infrastructure interactions.

Revolutionize SQL queries with Azure Open AI, delve into Langstream’s Gen AI framework, enhance Azure OpenAI models with vector search in Azure Cosmos DB, and master Apache Flink’s stream processing capabilities with Flink SQL.

Join me at Data Saturday Cape Town on September 30th for deeper insights.

item.title: Interesting Stuff - Week 36, 2023
item.description:
This week, discover event-driven systems with Dapr in Kubernetes, delve into AI compilers by Microsoft Research, and learn about OpenTelemetry for observability.

Uncover Formula 1 streaming data pipelines with Python, Kafka, RisingWave, and Confluent Cloud’s role in real-time insurance quotes.

Join me at Data Saturday Cape Town on September 30th, and save the date for AI & Data Infusion Roadshow Durban on November 11th.

item.title: Interesting Stuff - Week 35, 2023
item.description:
Embark on a tech-filled journey this week!

Learn how FYNDNA transformed HDFC Bank using Dapr. Explore Generative AI with Chat-GPT.

Stay ahead in streaming tech with Hubert Dulay, and dive into real-world Flink applications.

item.title: Interesting Stuff - Week 30, 2023
item.description:
üåü Discover the latest tech innovations in this week’s blog post! From managing and analyzing game data at scale using Azure PlayFab and Databricks, to exploring the powerful Ambassador Pattern for distributed systems.

Get ready for the exciting news about OpenAI Whisper’s arrival on Azure OpenAI Service and Azure AI Speech, along with the introduction of function calling. Don’t miss the insights on using Azure “Prompt Flow” and the fascinating potential of Apache Kafka as a mission-critical data fabric for GenAI.

Join us on this tech journey and mark your calendar for the upcoming Data Saturday events! üöÄüåê

item.title: Interesting Stuff - Week 3, 2023
item.description:
So, what do we have for Week 3, 2023?

A mixed bag: cool visualizations in Azure Data Explorer using Plotly. Interesting about the benefits and challenges of distributed computing. Comparison of different SQL-based streaming approaches and their use cases, including a look at a streaming database. An excellent post about Time in Flink. As a side note, I wish Flink’s time functions supported a more granular precision than milliseconds.

item.title: Interesting Stuff - Week 39, 2022
item.description:
Throughout the week, I read a lot of blog-posts, articles, and so forth that has to do with things that interest me:

  • AI/data science
  • data in general
  • data architecture
  • streaming
  • distributed computing
  • SQL Server
  • transactions (both db as well as non db)
  • and other “stuff”

This blog post is the “roundup” of the things that have been most interesting to me for the week just ending.
